pt: {sc}sinister{/sc} {sc}baleful{/sc} {sc}malign{/sc} mean seriously threatening evil or disaster. {sc}sinister{/sc} suggests a general or vague feeling of fear or apprehension on the part of the observer.
{sc}baleful{/sc} imputes perniciousness or destructiveness to something whether working openly or covertly.
{sc}malign{/sc} applies to what is inherently evil or harmful.

et: Middle English {it}balefull{/it} "(of humans or animals) bent upon mischief or destruction, malevolent, (of things) pernicious," also "wretched, miserable," going back to Old English {it}bealluful{/it} "full of evil, sinful," from {it}bealu{/it} {et_link|bale:1|bale:1} + {it}-ful{/it} {et_link|-ful:1|-ful:1}
